ARABIC: قَالُوا۟ مَن فَعَلَ هَٰذَا بِـَٔالِهَتِنَآ إِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'Who has done this to our gods? He is definitely one of the wrongdoers!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They asked (on return): "Who has done this to our gods? He is surely a mischief-monger."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (When they saw the idols in this state) they said: "Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is one of the wrong-doers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (When the people came to the temple and saw the broken idols) they asked each other, "Who has done this to our gods? He certainly is an unjust person".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They said, “Who has done this to our Gods? He is indeed cruel!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They said: "Who has done this to our gods He must indeed be one of the wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They said: Who has done this to our gods? Most surely he is one of the unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They said, 'Who has. done this with our gods? Surely he is one of the evildoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They said: Who hath done this to our gods? Surely it must be some evil-doer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Who has done this to our deities? He must be a wrongdoer."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They said: who hath wrought this to our gods? verily he is of the wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Whoever has done this to Our gods?! He is indeed a wrongdoer!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They said: "Who has done this to our aliha (gods)? He must indeed be one of the wrong-doers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Who has done this to our gods' they exclaimed. 'He must surely be a harmdoer'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “Who did this to our gods? He is certainly one of the wrongdoers.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:59] They said, upon returning and seeing what had been done, ‘Who has done this to our gods? Truly he is an evildoer’, in this regard.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: They entered the house of their idols. (They said: Who hath done this to our gods? Surely it must be some evil-doer) he committed an evil deed against our deities. 356
